communications.subject: City Records Request :: C000052-031225
communications.communication:
Dear Dave Maass: 
Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on 3/12/2025 and given the reference number C000052-031225 for tracking purposes. 
 Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records related to the use of any AI-assisted police report technology provided by the company Axon (previously known as Taser). This technology may be referred to as Draft One (https://www.axon.com/products/draft-one), the Axon Narrative Assistant, or by another name.

For more information on the Axon Narrative Assistant, please refer to the User Guide found at this link: https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/25418151-axon-narrative-assistant-user-guide_axon-records-1-1/.

For more information on Axon Draft One, please look at this page on the Axon website: https://www.axon.com/resources/closer-look-draft-one.

CONTRACT AND AGREEMENTS

1. All contracts, memorandums of understanding, and any other written agreements between this agency and Axon related to the use of Draft One, Narrative Assistant, or any other AI-assisted report generation tool provided by Axon.

Responsive records include all associated amendments, exhibits, and supplemental and supporting documentation.

If access to Draft One or similar tools is being provided via an existing contract or through an informal agreement, please provide the relevant contract or the relevant communication or agreement that facilitated the access. This includes all agreements, both formal and informal, including all trial access, even if that access does not or did not involve financial obligations.

2. All relevant terms of use, licensing agreements, and any other guiding materials;

TRAINING, POLICIES and USE MATERIAL

3. All training materials relevant to Draft One or Axon Narrative Assistant generated by this agency;

4. All training material provided by Axon to this agency regarding its use of Draft One;

5. All user manuals, other guidance materials, help documents, or related materials;

6. Guides, safety tests, and other supplementary material that mention Draft One provided by Axon from January 1, 2024 and the date this request is received;

7. All final reports, evaluations, reports, or other documentation concluding or summarizing a trial or evaluation period or pilot project;

8. Any and all policies related to the use of Draft One, the Narrative Assistant, or any other AI-assisted report generation offerings provided by Axon (An example of one such policy can be found here: https://cdn.muckrock.com/foia_files/2024/11/26/608_Computer_Software_and_Transcription-Assisted_Report_Generation.pdf);

COMMUNICATIONS
9. All communications sent or received by any representative of this agency with individuals representing Axon referencing the following term, including emails and attachments:
• Draft One
• Narrative Assistant
• AI-generated report

10. All communications sent to or received by any representative of this agency with each of the following email addresses, including attachments:
a. draftone@axon.com
b. bryan@axon.com
c. noahsw@axon.com
d. efleischli@axon.com (Erin Fleischli)
e. edriver@axon.com
f. eforester@axon.com (Evan Forester, Director of Product Marketing)
g. gsigman@axon.com (Gabriel Sigman, Technical Account Manager)

We ask that these materials be provided on a rolling basis; as your office collects and reviews records, we would appreciate it if your office would provide those materials to us incrementally. If possible, please provide any responsive contractual and financial materials within the statutorily-mandated public record law time frame. We would prefer communications to be provided next. Please contact us for further discussion regarding the search and release of these materials.

This request is not being made for commercial purposes. Please assess fees appropriately in accordance with a public records request being made in the public interest.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I request that all records be disclosed in their native, digital format and transmitted to us electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or by CD-ROM if not.

If you need any more information in order to process the request, or cannot process a portion of the request for any reason, please respond to the email address on this request or “aos@eff.org”. Further discussion may be conducted via email. Please let us know if a phone call will be necessary or desirable; such contact information will be provided upon request.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires business days.

Sincerely,
Jesse Cabrera
Research Assistant

Beryl Lipton
Senior Investigative Researcher

Dave Maass
Director of Investigations

Electronic Frontier Foundation

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fcampbell-police-department-18559%252Faxon-draft-one-records-campbell-police-department-182886%252F%253Femail%253Dasanders%252540campbellca.gov&url_auth_token=AABmA_puL3mwzkQUjY5luRX9Q-s%3A1tsYGi%3A1-cNHIcd6AdP_6c_4a0aUYHrRW3IvclvcuSpIHmGzLM 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. 
 
City of Campbell

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fcampbell-police-department-18559%252Faxon-draft-one-records-campbell-police-department-182886%252F%253Femail%253Dasanders%252540campbellca.gov&url_auth_token=AABmA_puL3mwzkQUjY5luRX9Q-s%3A1tsYGi%3A1-cNHIcd6AdP_6c_4a0aUYHrRW3IvclvcuSpIHmGzL Except as expressly noted below, the City will produce records responsive to you request. Under California law, record request must reasonably describe identifiable records and remain focused and specific. ( See Cal. Govt. Code § 7922.530(a); Rogers v. Superior Court , 19 Cal.App.4th 469, 481.) Additionally, cities are not required to create new records in response to a request. ( Haynie v. Superior Court, 26 Cal.4th 1061, 1075.) Nevertheless, the City has made a reasonable effort to search for and identify records that may fulfill your request. Regarding your request: 
 
  *

  *

This applies specifically to Items #4, #5, and #8. Publicly available copyrighted materials from Axon, including Axon Draft One, can be accessed online through a web search. We do not have any records for Items #6 and #7.

  *

These records are anticipated to be available no later than April 16, 2025. If they are ready earlier, I will provide an update and release them via the Records Center in the attachment section of your request. I, Mihui Cho, Police Records Supervisor is responsible for making these determinations, in consultation with the City Attorney. The City of Campbell has reviewed its files and has located responsive records to your request. Some of the records have been redacted per public records law. City Records Request - C000052-031225  For questions or additional information, please reply to this email. Sincerely, Mihui Cho 
Police Department

title: Bonuses (Los Angeles Police Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Bonuses (Los Angeles Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 

I am requesting copies of records related to department-specific pay, OT, or non-monetary gifts (challenge coins, medals, trophies) for bonus opportunities. These include opportunities like marksmanship bonuses or other skill-based rewards the department gives to officers. 

Documents, memos, or policies related to bonus opportunities, available bonuses, the amount or item given out, and requirements/standards to achieve those bonuses. 
Records from databases, Excel docs, or other recording documents outline officers who received the bonus, what it was for, dates, and reward amount or gift given. 
Please search 2018 to December 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.subject: Your City of Los Angeles public records request #25-2584 has been closed.
communications.communication:
City of Los Angeles ************************************************************************ Record request #25-2584 has been closed. The closure reason supplied was: Dear Requester,   We have received your request for:   "I am requesting copies of records related to department-specific pay, OT, or non-monetary gifts (challenge coins, medals, trophies) for bonus opportunities. These include opportunities like marksmanship bonuses or other skill-based rewards the department gives to officers.   Documents, memos, or policies related to bonus opportunities, available bonuses, the amount or item given out, and requirements/standards to achieve those bonuses.   Records from databases, Excel docs, or other recording documents outline officers who received the bonus, what it was for, dates, and reward amount or gift given.   Please search 2018 to December 2024."   Your request was made under the California Public Records Act (the Act). The Department is cognizant of its responsibilities under the Act. It recognizes the statutory scheme was enacted to maximize citizen access to the workings of government. The Act does not mandate disclosure of all documents within the government’s possession. Rather, by specific exemption and reference to other statutes, the Act recognizes that there are boundaries where the public’s right to access must be balanced against such weighty considerations as the right of privacy, a right of constitutional dimension under California Constitution, Article 1, Section 1. The law also exempts from disclosure records that are privileged or confidential or otherwise exempt under either express provisions of the Act or pursuant to applicable federal or state law, per California Government Code Sections 7927.200; 7927.700; 7923.600-7923.625; 7927.705; and 7922.000.   Regarding "Documents, memos, or policies related to bonus opportunities, available bonuses, the amount or item given out, and requirements/standards to achieve those bonuses":   Please be advised that the Department has conducted a search and that records responsive to your request may be found in Volume 3 Supervision of the Department Manual, which can be found at the following link.   LAPD Manual - LAPD Online   Regarding "Records from databases, Excel docs, or other recording documents outline officers who received the bonus, what it was for, dates, and reward amount or gift given":   To the extent that the Department has any records for Rex R Ingram, these records remain privileged, confidential, and exempt from disclosure, pursuant to the California Government Code Sections 7927.700 and 7927.705. Section 7927.700 exempts from disclosure “personnel, medical or similar files, the disclosure of which would constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy.” Section 7927.705 exempts records which are exempt from disclosure under federal or state law, including, but not limited to provisions of the Penal Code. Penal Code Section 832.7(a) states that peace officer personnel records and information contained within them are privileged and confidential and cannot be disclosed except through discovery pursuant to Sections 1043 and 1045 of the Evidence Code. Therefore, we are denying your request.   However, the City Controller may have records relevant to your request under the 'Payroll' section of their website available at the following link.   https://controller.lacity.gov/   If you have any questions, please respond to this email.   Respectfully,   LAPD Public Records & Subpoena Response Section, CPRA Unit ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at City of Los Angeles.
Technical support: See our help page

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center. 

Track the issue status and respond at: https://cps.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP//_rs/RequestEdit.aspx?rid=17083

title: Peregrine

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Peregrine
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act (California Government Code § 6250 et seq.)  I am writing to request access to and copies of all records, documents, communications, and data pertaining to the Modesto Police Department’s use, implementation, or involvement with the "Peregrine" technology or platform provided by Peregrine (https://www.peregrine.io/). All records should be from 1/1/2022 until the date this is processed.

Specifically, I am requesting the following:

Contracts, agreements, and memorandums of understanding related to Peregrine.

Policies, procedures, and guidelines governing the use of Peregrine technology.

Training materials, presentations, or communications regarding the Peregrine platform.

Reports, audits, or assessments evaluating the performance or effectiveness of Peregrine.

Correspondence, including emails and internal memos, that mention "Peregrine" or related terms.  Please also include all email correspondence to any representative using a peregrine.io email address ( *@peregrine.io ) 

If possible, I request that the records be provided in an electronic format. Please inform me of any fees for processing this request prior to fulfilling it. If my request is denied in whole or in part, please justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions under the law.



I look forward to your response within the legally required timeframe. Please do not hesitate to contact me if you require any further information to process this request.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

communications.subject: Your City of Modesto CA public records request #25-154 has been submitted.
communications.communication:
City of Modesto CA ************************************************************************ Your record request #25-154 has been submitted successfully. Please be advised that your California Public Records Act request has been submitted. Your request will be processed in compliance with the Public Records Act. Pursuant to California Government Code § 7922.535, the City shall, within 10 days from receipt of the request, determine whether the request, in whole or in part, will be made available and shall promptly notify the person making the request of the determination and the reasons therefore. Requests are received during normal business hours. City offices are open Monday through Friday, from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., excluding holidays. Requests submitted while the office is closed, such as after hours, weekends or holidays, will be opened and received the next business day. In certain circumstances, the time limit prescribed in this section may be extended by written notice to the person making the request, setting forth the reasons for the extension and the date on which a determination is expected to be dispatched. Please note that you will be contacted when the information is available. All document duplication fees are due and payable in full and are based on the City’s current fee resolution. ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact City of Modesto CA.

Change your email settings | Visit our help center

City of Modesto CA ************************************************************************ A document has been released for record request #25-154 along with the following message: Dear Requester, This notification is in response to your written request for public records received by the City. We are treating your request as a request for public records in accordance with California Government Code Section 7920.000 and following (the California Public Records Act, or “the Act”). The Act requires that public agencies make reasonably identified, non-exempt public records available for inspection or provide copies upon payment of the direct costs of duplication. This email satisfies the City’s requirement to notify you within ten (10) days whether the requested records will be disclosed. (Gov. Code 7922.535.) Responsive, non-exempt public records have been recovered, and are attached. This completes the City's response for this request. * 11054286_11261985Executed Peregrine Agreement Only.pdf Document links are valid for one month. 2. N016879-020625
3. N016620-122024
4. N016553-120224
5. N016413-102924

This request is made on behalf of The FOIA Bakery. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center.

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – November 10, 2024

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – November 10, 2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: November 10, 2024
Suspect: Nick Fuentes
Incident Summary: Officers responded to a report that Nick Fuentes had pepper-sprayed and shoved a woman who had come to his residence. The victim stated she rang the doorbell, at which point Fuentes opened the door, immediately used pepper spray on her, and pushed her down the steps. He allegedly took her phone before returning inside. When officers arrived, Fuentes was uncooperative, initially refusing to speak about the incident and attempting to lead officers to the backyard rather than discussing the matter in the designated area. He was later arrested for battery.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Responded to the initial report and engaged with Nick Fuentes.
Retrieved the victim’s phone.
Participated in the investigation and subsequent arrest.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Harun

communications.subject: [Records Center] FOI Records Request :: R000126-031125
communications.communication:
RE: FOI Records Request created on March 11, 2025, Reference # R000126-031125 
 
Dear Toni , 
 
This message is to acknowledge receipt of your Freedom of Information request submitted on March 11, 2025 by the Department of Administrative Services. 
 
This letter does not constitute a denial of your request. Rather, in accordance with the Freedom of Information Act, we are in the process of researching and gathering documentation which may be responsive to it. Once the documents are gathered, we will then conduct a review to determine if statutory exemptions to disclosure may apply to some or all of the documents. Upon completion of that review, we will be able to provide you with any responsive, non-exempt documents. 
 
Please note the department reserves the right to charge any such other fees as may be appropriate pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act. 
 
Sincerely, 
 
Procurement Division

title: Certificate data

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Certificate data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello,

My name's Marina VIlleneuve and I'm an investigative reporter for The Hechinger Report.

As you're aware, states report data on exiting students with disabilities.
https://data.ed.gov/dataset/idea-section-618-state-part-b-exiting/resources

The data includes numbers of students leaving with alternative certificates, including GEDS.

Texas, for example, reported 13,952 students exited with certificates in 2022-2023

Under Texas' public records act, I am requesting the following data:

For school years 2022-2023, 2017-2018 and 2012-2013,

the number of students with disabilities under IDEA who received
1) certificates of completion,
2) modified diplomas and
3) GEDS.

I am requesting that data broken out by each category. The Texas DOE said I should submit a public records request for this data.

Sincerely,
Marina Villeneuve
Investigative Reporter,
Hechinger Report

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marina Villeneuve

Thank you for contacting the Texas Education Agency. I want to acknowledge receipt of your request. Your request number is PIR # 73158.



Our Public Information Request Coordinators are processing your request in coordination with the area(s) that may have the responsive information/data.  A response to your request should be provided on or before 10 business days: January 8, 2025.  Should you not receive a response within this timeline, please do not hesitate to contact our office and ask to speak to one of our Coordinators.



If you have any questions or wish to discuss this matter further, please contact me at (512) 463-3464 or by email at PIR@tea.texas.gov<file:///C:/Users/fzuma/AppData/Local/Temp/PIR@tea.texas.gov>.

Jenny Eaton

communications.subject: PIR # 73158 Programming and/or Manipulation of Data Statement of Cost Estimate
communications.communication:
Public Information Request

Programming and/or Manipulation of Data

Statement of Cost Estimate

December 19, 2024



Marina Villeneuve

MuckRock News

DEPT MR 177527

263 Huntington Ave

Boston, MA 02115



TEA PIR #73158



Dear Marina Villeneuve:



On December 13, 2024, the Texas Education Agency (TEA) received your request for public information.  Because the cost to fulfill your request will exceed $100.00 and requires programming and/or manipulation of data, TEA must provide an itemized statement of estimated charges that may be included in your final Invoice Statement.


The Statement of Cost Estimate for your request is enclosed.  Please note that full payment is not due at this time, only the deposit amount.

Data Specifications
The attached Statement of Cost Estimate is for work to produce the information responsive to your request.

Less Costly Alternatives and Format
On the enclosed cost estimate, please indicate the method by which you wish to receive the information.  TEA must provide you the information in its original format.  However, if TEA has the technology to do so, it will provide you the information in other formats.  ‎There are less expensive ways for you to obtain this information.  These charges may be reduced if you narrow or clarify the scope of your request (reduce data fields, timeline, etc.).  Additionally, other alternative options for less costly or no-cost way of accessing the information, such as TEA website or in person inspection, may be described in this letter, if available.


Anticipated date on which your records/data will be released to you is indicated on the enclosed statement (based on 35 business days to complete the work) and it is recalculated from the date the agency receives your payment of the deposit, as work will not begin until the minimum 50% deposit is received.

‎Deposit
TEA requires a deposit before beginning to retrieve and prepare the information for you to review or receive.  The deposit is required when costs to make the information available exceeds $100.00, or the information is older than five (5) years old, or the information will fill six (6) archival boxes and more than five hours is estimated to make the information available.  This deposit amount will be 50% of the entire estimated amount and will be reflected in the enclosed cost estimate.

Adjustment to Estimated Cost
Occasionally, after starting the work, but before making the information available to you, TEA may find that the actual cost will exceed the initial estimate.  In this case, if the cost estimate exceeds more than 20% above the estimated amount, TEA will issue a new cost estimate for approval.  You must respond to the adjusted statement within 30 business days or your request will be considered withdrawn.  If the actual cost is below or it exceeds the estimated amount, but by no more than 20%, the cost will be adjusted in the invoice.

Confidential or Excepted Information
If the records or data you are requesting includes student identifying information TEA will withhold this information in compliance with the federal Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA), 20 U.S.C. Section 1232g.  TEA is required to withhold from public disclosure personally identifiable, non-directory information in education records. Additionally, FERPA does not permit state and local educational authorities to disclose to the Office of the Attorney General (OAG) personally identifiable information contained in education records for the purpose of review in the open records ruling process under the Texas Public Information Act.  The United States Department of Education has ruled FERPA determinations must be made by the educational authority in possession of the education records.  Consequently, it is impermissible for TEA to seek an OAG opinion concerning the applicability of FERPA to records responsive to a public information request.  https://www.texasattorneygeneral.gov/sites/default/files/files/divisions/open-government/20060725-USDept-Education.pdf

‎If the records or data you are requesting includes social security numbers of a living person, TEA will withhold this information by removing it from the record before releasing it to you.  TEA must protect this information under the Texas Public Information Act and is authorized to do so without requesting a decision from the Texas Attorney General. (Open Records Decision No. 634 (1995); Government Code §552.147)

Important 30-day Timeline
So that your request is not automatically withdrawn, you must respond to TEA about the cost estimate within 30 business days from the date this estimate is sent to you.

On the enclosed cost estimate, you must indicate whether:

1. You accept the charges and submit payment of the required deposit amount;
2. You have attached a modified request and request another estimate;
3. You withdraw your request entirely; or
4. You filed a complaint with the Cost Rules Administrator, Office of Attorney General; and provided a copy of your complaint to the Public Information Coordination Office, TEA Legal Services [§552.2615 of the Government Code].

Return your response within 30 business days to:
‎
Modified Request, Denied or Accepted Cost Estimate:
Payment Address:
TEA - Public Information Coordinator
TEA – PIR 73158
1701 North Congress Avenue
P.O. Box 13717
Austin, Texas 78701-1494
Austin, TX 78711-3717
FAX: (512) 463-1022

E-MAIL: PIR@tea.texas.gov<mailto:PIR@tea.texas.gov>


‎Accepted payment methods by mail are money orders and checks, made payable to “Texas Education Agency- PIR”. We do not accept credit card or online payments at this time. Please include your PIR number with your payment; the payment address is listed above. In person payments are currently accepted by the TEA Accounting office on weekdays between 8:00 am -10:00 am. If you would like to make a payment during business hours outside this timeframe, please contact the PIR office to arrange an appointment.

If you have any questions or wish to discuss this matter further, please contact me at (512) 463-3464 or by email at PIR@tea.texas.gov<mailto:PIR@tea.texas.gov>.

Sincerely,


Jenny Eaton
Public Information Coordinator

Enclosures:
Original Request
Itemized Statement of Cost Estimate

title: Request to Postal Service for all 2024 movie collaborations

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request to Postal Service for all 2024 movie collaborations
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of all the films that the U.S. Postal Service has participated in the production of, in any capacity whatsoever, for the year 2024. Any and all such lists, full or partial, would be appreciated and may include, but are not limited to, entertainment liaison (ELO) reports, production assistance agreements, or similar internal documents. I request that you search for these documents in any location where they might be located, including but not limited to the entertainment liaison offices, public affairs offices, and communications HQ.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2025-FPRO-00991
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern,

I am writing to appeal the finding regarding request no. 2025-FPRO-00991.

In your response to my request, you wrote that my request was "overly broad." My request is already quite specific, pertaining only to film collaborations by USPS in a single calendar year. You mentioned that you keep records in 30,000 or so locations, and yet presumably the type of record I am requesting would not require a search of all of these locations. Furthermore, in my original request, I singled out the communications HQ, public relations offices, and/or related offices as the likely locations of such records. 

I will, however, amend my request to specifically limit the search to the above-mentioned offices, omitting the clause "in any location." If it is helpful, I will also limit my request to production assistance agreements or similar documents.

I therefore reiterate my request under the foregoing qualifications.

Respectfully,

Brett Carollo

title: Annatoyn NextEra

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Annatoyn NextEra
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all written or electronic communications, including email attachments, between Travis Annatoyn and any officials, lobbyists, representatives or other staffers affiliated with NextEra Energy, the renewable energy company. This request also seeks all written or electronic communications sent or received by Travis Annatoyn that contains one or more of the following key words or phrases: "NextEra", "MBTA', "bald eagles" and/or" golden eagles". This request seeks records produced since January 20, 2021. 

I am a reporter with The Guardian, The Nation and other outlets.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jimmy Tobias

We are currently processing your request.  There are 16 requests in the Complex tract ahead of yours.  I estimate a release for this request to be made in December of this year.  As processing of your request continues, we will let you know if there is any change to that estimate.

Thank you,

Saundra Brinsley

communications.subject: SOL-2021-006215 FOIA Request
communications.communication:
Good afternoon, I am the new processor assigned to your FOIA Request SOL-2021-006215. Currently, this is an open request in our case-management system seeking records for:

“Any and all written or electronic communications, including email attachments, between Travis Annatoyn and any officials, lobbyists, representatives or other staffers affiliated with NextEra Energy, the renewable energy company. This request also seeks all written or electronic communications sent or received by Travis Annatoyn that contains one or more of the following key words or phrases: "NextEra", "MBTA', "bald eagles" and/or" golden eagles". This request seeks records produced since January 20, 2021.”

Please confirm if you are still interested in receiving documents for this request. If, upon review, you are no longer interested in this request please let us know so that we may close this request in our case-management system.

Respectfully,

Tiffany Wilhelm
Government Information Specialist
Records & Law Practice Support, Division of Administration
Office of the Solicitor | U.S. Department of the Interior

title: Immigration Enforcement

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Immigration Enforcement
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- All communications between the Mineral County Sheriff’s office and U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement from January 1, 2025 to March 10, 2025. 
- All communications between the Mineral County Sheriff’s office and Tom Homan from January 1, 2025 to March 10, 2025. 
- Any records regarding the Delegation of Immigration Authority Section 287(g) Immigration and Nationality Act 
- A copy of the agreement for the Mineral County Sheriff's office to join ICE’s Section 287 (g) program

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Taylor Moore

communications.subject: RE: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Immigration Enforcement
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Nevada Public Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on March 10, 2025. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

Here is the public information request you requested.  We will not be
participating in the 287 program.  The Sheriff does not want to be a part
of this program.

title: 2010 Crime Incidents Request (Corpus Christi Police Department)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: 2010 Crime Incidents Request (Corpus Christi Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting data on crime incidents—those classified by your agency as crimes—rather than calls for service or unfounded incidents.
• Year(s) Requested: 2010
• Columns Requested: Incident date, Incident time, Type of crime (e.g., robbery, theft, etc.), Incident ID, and all other available columns that do not require additional processing by the agency or redaction.

If the data are stored in a proprietary or custom electronic format not publicly available, I request that it be converted to a format viewable with standard software, such as Microsoft Excel or CSV. Please avoid providing data in PDF or paper printouts.

This request is made to support academic research conducted in the public interest and is not for commercial purposes. The data will contribute to a research project assessing the effect of music concerts on crime, aiming to enhance public understanding of how large events influence community safety.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kristina Block

title: Information on actions taken and plans to comply with OPM DEIA guidance

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Information on actions taken and plans to comply with OPM DEIA guidance
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

By way of background: 

On January 29, 2025 and February 5, 2025, Charles Ezell, Acting Director, U.S. Office of Personnel Management, sent memos to all Heads and Acting Heads of Departments and Agencies entitled "Initial Guidance Regarding DEIA Executive Orders" and "Further Guidance Regarding Ending DEIA Offices, Programs and Initiatives," respectively. Amongst other things, the memos instructed all Heads and Acting Heads of Departments and Agencies to prepare reports to be sent to DEIAreports@opm.gov, and that generally, "agencies should terminate all illegal DEIA initiatives, [...] policies, programs, and practices."

Pursuant to the the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1.) A complete list of actions taken in response to the above two OPM memos.

2.) A copy of any agency plans to fully comply with the above two OPM memos.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 days.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Daisy McDonald.

To whom it may concern, 

On January 22, 2025, the Goldwater Scholarship Foundation received an email from Devin Cummings regarding the Presidents Executive Order pertaining to DEIA activities of our agency.  My response to that memo is copied below.  There have been no subsequent responses or actions taken regarding DEIA activities at the Goldwater Scholarship Foundation.

John Mateja, PhD
President 
Goldwater Scholarship Foundation

___________

From: Goldwater President 
Sent: Wednesday, January 22, 2025 2:08 PM 
To: Cummings, Devin L <devin_cummings@ibc.doi.gov> 
Subject: RE: PLEASE READ URGENT: Initial Guidance Regarding DEIA Executive Orders 

Good afternoon, Mr. Cummings, 

The Goldwater Scholarship Foundation has three full-time employees, none of whom have any DEIA responsibilities. All staff have been notified of the issues raised in your email. We have no DEIA outward facing media associated with a DEIA office as we do not have such an office. 

Similarly, we have no DEIA-related contractors or DEIA-related training. 

Let me know if I can be of any further assistance. 

John Mateja, PhD 
President 
Goldwater Scholarship Foundation

title: State and outside compensation records for VA Tech professor

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: State and outside compensation records for VA Tech professor
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Records Custodian,

I seek records regarding the compensation of Dr. Broderick Turner, assistant professor of marketing at Virginia Tech. Specifically I seek records generated from January 1, 2020 to the present date that provide the following:

-Amounts and terms of Dr. Turner’s annual compensation as a university employee (salary, stipends, etc)

-Amounts and terms of any outside compensation Dr. Turner has disclosed to Virginia Tech pursuant to university policies on outside compensation.

-Any disclosures Dr. Turner has provided to Virginia Tech related to work with Axon Enterprise Inc., in his capacity as a member of Axon’s Ethics and Equity Advisory Council (EEAC), and/or in any other capacity, including amounts of compensation, terms of compensation, and the scope of tasks performed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Scott Gordon.

communications.subject: RE: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request #24-644
communications.communication:
Hi, thank you for getting back to me and for providing this salary information. 

As for the part of my request that you have denied, I do understand that a variety of different personnel info is not available to the public. As I understand it, though, sometimes information about a public employee's outside compensation can be considered public record when it relates to possible conflicts of interest. I am seeking information about any compensation Dr. Turner earns from Axon Industries, because that company is active in an area that is a frequent subject of Turner's writing and research. I'm not sure if this changes anything, but thought that providing this context might help.

In any case, thanks for your help and your time.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Sandra Doorley Traffic Stop

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Sandra Doorley Traffic Stop
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: 04/22/2024
Location: Webster, New York (Phillips Road and Doorley’s residence)
Individual Involved: Sandra Doorley (Monroe County District Attorney)
Incident Summary: On the date of the incident, DA Sandra Doorley was reportedly stopped for speeding—driving 55 mph in a 35 mph zone. Instead of pulling over, she called Webster Police Chief Dennis Kohlmeier and proceeded home, refusing to comply with the officer’s order to stop. Bodycam footage shows a tense exchange in which she stated she "didn’t feel like stopping" and refused to exit her garage. The officer informed her that failure to stop is an arrestable offense.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Attempted to pull over Sandra Doorley for the traffic violation.
Responded to her residence and engaged in conversation with her.
Communicated with Police Chief Dennis Kohlmeier regarding the situation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Untitled

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request the NCAA Membership Financial Reporting System revenue and expense reports for fiscal years 2004 & 2024.  Specifically:  

These reports are completed by the athletic department for the National Collegiate Athletic Association for the fiscal years listed above. This report is a multi-page document that had to be submitted to the NCAA in January. It contains 40+ revenue and expense categories, followed by specific breakdowns of each of those categories, by sport and gender. I am requesting the full report, including the detail tables, the “Other Reporting Items” list and the “Statement of Revenues and Expenses” that appears at the end of the report. PLEASE NOTE: The NCAA report is different than the equity report that is sent to the U.S. Department of Education for Title IX compliance.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Stacey Brook.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request :: V004318-013025
communications.communication:
Hello Tom: I am writing to acknowledge receipt by the University of Virginia of your request for records under the Virginia Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), Va. Code § 2.2-3700 et seq., for the following: 
 
  *  
 To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request the NCAA Membership Financial Reporting System revenue and expense reports for fiscal years 2004 & 2024. Specifically:

These reports are completed by the athletic department for the National Collegiate Athletic Association for the fiscal years listed above. This report is a multi-page document that had to be submitted to the NCAA in January. It contains 40+ revenue and expense categories, followed by specific breakdowns of each of those categories, by sport and gender. I am requesting the full report, including the detail tables, the “Other Reporting Items” list and the “Statement of Revenues and Expenses” that appears at the end of the report. PLEASE NOTE: The NCAA report is different than the equity report that is sent to the U.S. Department of Education for Title IX compliance.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Stacey Brook Under FOIA, UVA has five working days to respond to your request.  You will receive an initial response by 2/7/2025.  If not practically possible to provide the requested records or to determine their availability within five working days, FOIA allows for UVA to request an additional seven working days.  Va. Code § 2.2-3704(A)(4).  If additional time is needed to fulfill your request, we will make reasonable efforts to reach an agreement with you for records production as required under FOIA.  Va. Code §§ 2.2-3700 and 2.2-3704(C). Please note that UVA may recover its actual costs incurred in processing your request.  This includes costs incurred in accessing, duplicating, supplying, or searching for the records you have requested, including, but not limited to, the costs of reviewing records to determine whether or not they are public records responsive to your request, exempt under FOIA, or may not lawfully be disclosed pursuant to some other provision of law (See Va. Code §2.2-3704(F)). If costs are estimated to exceed $200, we require advanced payment prior to fulfilling a request.  Va. Code § 2.2-3704(H).  If costs are estimated to be less than $200, actual costs incurred by UVA will be billed to you after you receive your response.  We will let you know of any costs in advance. For additional information about the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, please visit our website at https://universitycounsel.virginia.edu/foia. Hello Tom: I am writing in response to your request for records under the Virginia Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), Va. Code § 2.2-3700 et seq., for the following: 
 To Whom It May Concern: 
 
Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records: 
 
I request the NCAA Membership Financial Reporting System revenue and expense reports for fiscal years 2004 & 2024. Specifically: 
 
These reports are completed by the athletic department for the National Collegiate Athletic Association for the fiscal years listed above. This report is a multi-page document that had to be submitted to the NCAA in January. It contains 40+ revenue and expense categories, followed by specific breakdowns of each of those categories, by sport and gender. I am requesting the full report, including the detail tables, the “Other Reporting Items” list and the “Statement of Revenues and Expenses” that appears at the end of the report. PLEASE NOTE: The NCAA report is different than the equity report that is sent to the U.S. Department of Education for Title IX compliance. 
 
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 
 
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 
 
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 
 
Sincerely, 
 
Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Stacey Brook The University has provided a free cost estimate below.  Please review the attached handout titled “FOIA Costs-University of Virginia” for additional details regarding your cost estimate. Cost Estimate:

To make payment, please submit a check payable to the University of Virginia to: Office of the University Counsel Attn: FOIA Office P.O. Box 400225 Charlottesville, VA 22904 Please let us know if you approve the above costs. If over $200, please submit advance payment for us to proceed with your request. For additional information about the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, please visit our website at https://universitycounsel.virginia.edu/foia.  Thank you for contacting this office. title: FOIA Request for Case-Related Materials - Johnny Trigg

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: FOIA Request for Case-Related Materials - Johnny Trigg
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to public records under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA). Specifically, I am requesting any and all records and materials related to the case of

Suspect Name: Johnny Trigg
Description/Headline: Man sentenced for deadly shooting that lead to SWAT standoff in Dayton
Link of the Article: https://www.cbsnews.com/news/chandler-halderson-wisconsin-double-murder-bart-and-krista-halderson-48-hours/
State: ohio
Law Enforcement: Dayton pd 

included but not limited to the following:
Documents:
Incident reports
Investigation reports
Officer statements
Witness statements
Any other relevant case files

Footage:
Body camera footage from officers on the scene
Dash camera footage
Police surveillance camera footage
Private/public surveillance footage from nearby locations
Any footage collected as evidence or during the investigation

Audio:
911 calls
Police radio communications
Any other audio recordings related to the case
Visual Media:
Crime scene photographs
Surveillance stills
Photographs taken during the investigation

Court Records:
Transcripts from court hearings or proceedings
Any video/audio footage from court hearings
Court orders or any other court-related documents

Please include any and all materials, regardless of format (digital or physical), including those not listed above that are related to the case in question.
Additionally, if this request has been sent to the wrong department or agency, I would appreciate it if you could provide guidance or contact information for the correct department or agency that handles such requests.

If any part of the request is denied or redacted, please provide a detailed explanation of the specific legal exemption that applies.
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response within the period mandated by FOIA.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

david yupa

communications.subject: [External Message Added] City of Dayton, OH public records request #25-127
communications.communication:
City of Dayton, OH ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #25-127: Our DPD office will generate a link for police video requests. We wanted to make you aware, the time frame to receive these videos is approximately12-16 weeks. Sunshine Laws (Chapter 2) B. Statutes that Modify General Rights and Duties 4. Modified records access for certain requesters b. Commercial requesters Commercial requesters Unless a specific statute provides otherwise, it is irrelevant whether the intended use of requested records is for commercial purposes. However, if an individual or entity is making public records requests for commercial purposes, the public office receiving the requests can limit the number of records “that the office will physically deliver by United States mail or by another delivery service to ten per month.” For purposes of this limitation, the term “commercial purposes” is to be narrowly construed and does not include the following activities: • Reporting or gathering news; • Reporting or gathering information to assist citizen oversight or understanding of the operation or activities of government; or • Nonprofit educational research. ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at City of Dayton, OH.
Technical support: See our help page

title: Brady List (January 2024)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Brady List (January 2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current "Brady lists" and "Giglio lists" (per Brady v. Maryland/Giglio v. United States) maintained by your office.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

title: Central Arkansas football game contracts

communications.subject: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Central Arkansas football game contracts
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All University of Central Arkansas football game contracts, amendments, and/or cancellations for non-conference opponents for the 2024 season through the 2040 season.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sonny Albarado, a citizen of Arkansas, in coordination with Kevin Kelley.

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 

I am requesting records related to the officer's off-duty records. Please search 2019 to today. 
Copies of the department's PERMIT FOR SECONDARY EMPLOYMENT. 
Policies related to secondary employment of officers

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

title: CENTRAL KITSAP SCHOOL DISTRICT - JLARC (2024) Agency Costs Fulfilling Public Records Requests Including Litigation for the year 2024

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: CENTRAL KITSAP SCHOOL DISTRICT - JLARC (2024) Agency Costs Fulfilling Public Records Requests Including Litigation for the year 2024
communications.communication:
January 12, 2025

via email to CherylPo@ckschools.org

CENTRAL KITSAP SCHOOL DISTRICT - JLARC (2024) Agency Costs Fulfilling Public Records Requests Including Litigation for the year 2024
 
To whom it may concern,

RCW 40.14.026(5)

“To improve best practices for dissemination of public records, each agency with actual staff and legal costs associated with fulfilling public records requests of at least one hundred thousand dollars during the prior fiscal year must… report to the joint legislative audit and review committee by July 1st of each subsequent year the following metrics, measured over the preceding year:

RCW 40.14.026(5)(l)

(l) The estimated costs incurred by the agency in fulfilling records requests, including costs for staff compensation and legal review, and a measure of the average cost per request;

RCW 40.14.026(5)(o)

(o) The costs incurred by the agency with managing and retaining records, including staff compensation and purchases of equipment, hardware, software, and services to manage and retain public records or otherwise assist in the fulfillment of public records requests;

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST RCW 42.56

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

1. Please provide all "Public Records" (as defined by WAC 44-14-03001) detailing costs incurred by your agency in fulfilling records requests, including staff compensation, legal review, and any public records related litigation costs and/or legal settlements for the year 2024 and complete copies of all records request realted fee payments paid to your agency in 2024.

Responsive public records should include but are not limited to:

Supplies and services external services (e.g., printing services, large format printing) Mailing costs, supplies (CDs, DVDs, USB sticks, etc.) Staff compensation and benefit records, copies of payments of Public Records Fees Collected, Software licensing, public records portal and database software licensing and costs, purchases of equipment, hardware, software, and services to manage and retain public records or otherwise assist in the fulfillment of public records requests, professional services Agency staff costs, copies of billing for all Legal costs – including copies of all litigation Legal settlements related to public records requests litigation of any kind and copies of costs for staff time associated with invoicing and collection.

RECORDS INSTALLMENTS

If production of responsive records will be completed in multiple installments, please begin by producing records in the numerical order requested by subject matter and year. The most recent public records should be produced first.

DEFINITION OF RECORDS AND WRITINGS

RECORDS AND WRITINGS as defined by RCW 42.56.010(4): any handwriting, typewriting, printing, photostating, photographing, and every other means of recording any form of communication or representation including, but not limited to, letters, words, pictures, sounds, or symbols, or combination thereof, and all papers, maps, magnetic or paper tapes, photographic films and prints, motion picture, film and video recordings, magnetic or punched cards, discs, drums, diskettes, sound recordings, and other documents including existing data compilations from which information may be obtained or translated.

PRODUCTION AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

Please provide all records in their native electronic format. Please do not instead create new records by printing electronic files then scanning and printing the newly scanned prints.

The use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA or NEXTREQUEST) for communication and production of records in response to a public records request is optional for the requestor in the State of Washington. Respectfully we decline to use any 3rd party "portal" system, specifically GOVQA and NEXTREQUEST. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment, or via no password, no registration internet cloud-based download link.

Please do not direct or invite us to use, register for, or communicate with your agency via any 3rd party portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other commercial 3rd party records portal service.

Constructive Notice: Any and all communication(s) received on behalf of your agency in reference to this Public Records Request (RCW 42.45) from any unauthorized for-profit 3rd party company doing business outside the State of Washington will be the subject of a new public records request to your agency as to the origin and purpose of the communication as well as the identity of the sender of the communication.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUESTS SUBMITTED VIA EMAIL

RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.

"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format. Unless the records exist IN PAPER FORM ONLY, DO NOT instead create new records by printing native stored electronic files, then scanning and re-printing these newly scanned prints only to reproduce them in again in electronic production.

EMAIL RECORDS

Please provide any and all email records in NATIVE .pst electronic format.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION - FAMILY EDUCATIONAL RIGHTS AND PRIVACY ACT (FERPA)

Take caution with the broad application of redaction and withholding of identified public records claiming "global FERPA" exemptions. When an agency claims an exemption for an entire record or portion of one, it must inform the requestor of the statutory exemption and provide a brief explanation of how the exemption applies to the record or portion withheld. RCW 42.17.310(4)/42.56.210(3). The brief explanation should cite the statute the agency claims grant an exemption from disclosure. The brief explanation should provide enough information for a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the claimed exemption is proper. Global, nonspecific claims of exemption such as "FERPA" are insufficient. One way to properly provide a brief explanation of the withheld record or redaction is for the agency to provide a withholding index. It identifies the type of record, its date and number of pages, and the author or recipient of the record (unless their identity is exempt). The withholding index should allow a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the agency has properly invoked the exemption. There are several exceptions to the FERPA exemption and any agency silently withholding large swaths of public records citing "FERPA!" without providing the original identified record, properly redacted, or if withheld in its entirety, providing a record description and page count or record length, will be challenged in accordance with RCW 42.56.550 if a reasonably detailed withholding index or exemption log is not included.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

COMMUNICATION VIA EMAIL

Please send all requests for clarification, status updates, and production of responsive electronic documents via direct email.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Good Luck.

We received your initial request on Monday and thanks for this follow-up. We have begun researching records responsive to your request. It appears pretty straightforward and there are no clarifying questions right now. We may have questions as we get into each individual item.

Current estimate for full production is March 14, 2025, with installments provided as we work through the parts.

Have a good weekend.

Cheryl

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: CENTRAL KITSAP SCHOOL DISTRICT - JLARC (2024) Agency Costs Fulfilling Public Records Requests Including Litigation for the year 2024
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

Thanks for writing. I appreciate that.

Attached are records responsive to your request. There should be 19 attachments here.

I’ve broken out the components you requested and made notations as listed below.

costs incurred by your agency in fulfilling records requests, including

     *   staff compensation,
     *   legal review, and
     *   any public records related litigation costs and/or
     *   legal settlements for the year 2024 and
     *   complete copies of all records request related fee payments paid to your agency in 2024.

Responsive public records should include but are not limited to:

  1.  Supplies attached
  2.  services no responsive records
  3.  external services (e.g., printing services, large format printing) no responsive records
  4.  Mailing costs, attached
  5.  supplies (CDs, DVDs, USB sticks, etc.) same as no 1
  6.  Staff compensation and benefit records, no responsive records
  7.  copies of payments of Public Records Fees Collected, attached
  8.  Software licensing, no responsive records, except as attached in response to no. 8
  9.  public records portal and database software licensing and costs attached
  10. purchases of equipment, no responsive records
  11. hardware, no responsive records
  12. software, and no responsive records, except as attached in response to no. 8
  13. services to manage and retain public records or otherwise assist in the fulfillment of public records requests, no responsive records, except as attached in response to no. 8
  14. professional services Agency staff costs, no responsive records
  15. copies of billing for all Legal costs – attached
  16. including copies of all litigation attached
  17. Legal settlements related to public records requests attached
  18. litigation of any kind and no other responsive records except as attached in 16
  19. copies of costs for staff time associated with invoicing and collection. no responsive records


With this email, we’d like to inform you that we have fulfilled the request and have closed this request. As required by Cousins v. Department of Corrections, we are notifying you that the Public Records Act’s one-year statute of limitations has begun to run because having closed the request for the reasons described above, we do not intend to further address the request.

Please call or email me anytime if any questions.


Regards,
Cheryl

____________________________________________________
Cheryl Portier – Operations - 360-662-1616

Our Vision-A vibrant and inclusive learning community where all students find their passion and achieve their dreams.

Our Mission-Provide a high-quality Pre-K through 12th grade education to ensure all students graduate college and career ready.
Our Core Values-Keeping our core values at the forefront helps us focus our priorities.

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Patron Incident Reports - July 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

All Patron Incident Reports submitted for the Area Manager 5 North Region in July 2023.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit Lucy Parsons Labs for the purpose of public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexandra Gelzin
