communications.communication:
Dear Requestor,


Please see the attached documents for RE: FOIA 5982 AGelzin PIR - July 2023 - Part 1

title: 727 Shelter

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: 727 Shelter
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide all emails about reopening the 727 Massachusetts ave shelter in the last three months. Please include any permit requests as well.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian McCarter

communications.subject: RE: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: 727 Shelter
communications.communication:
Hello Mr. McCarter,

Having reviewed your reply to BPHC's initial response, BPHC is in agreement that additional records can now be produced pursuant to your request.  BPHC requires 10 additional business days to adequately complete your request, subject to the underlying change in circumstances.

Please be advised that previously, all records pertaining to this matter were exempted from disclosure pursuant to the Deliberative Process exemption, Massachusetts Public Records Law, M.G.L. c. 4, § 7(26)(d), and were not subject to review and disclosure. Thus, the additional extension is necessary to retrieve and review the requested records.
Thank you for your patience and understanding in this matter.

Sincerely,

title: FCC Complaints - 60 Minutes interview with Kamala Harris

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FCC Complaints - 60 Minutes interview with Kamala Harris
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All complaints submitted to the FCC related to an interview with Kamala Harris that aired on 60 Minutes. This interview first aired in October 2024. Please provided all complaints submitted and received by this agency, including but not limited to all those sent to your agency in accordance with the direction found here: https://consumercomplaints.fcc.gov/hc/en-us/articles/34983255050644-Interested-in-adding-your-comments-to-the-proceeding-investigating-news-distortion-in-the-airing-of-a-60-Minutes-interview-with-then-Vice-President-Kamala-Harris-Learn-more-here.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Beryl Lipton

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All email correspondence, with attachments, mentioning "Water Property Investors," "Water Property Investor II," or "Water Property Investor III." 

2. Pitch decks, prospectuses, or any other materials provided to NMERB by the the above funds for consideration of potential investments.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Julia Rock

communications.subject: Fw: [EXTERNAL] New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Records Requestor:


Your request for information from the New Mexico Educational Retirement Board was forwarded to me. In accordance with the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act (IPRA), “a written request shall provide the name, address and telephone number of the person seeking access to the records and shall identify the records sought with reasonable particularity.” Section 14-2-8(C) NMSA 1978.


If you will provide me with your name and mailing address, we can begin the process of allowing inspection of the relevant records.


The Inspection of Public Records Act can be found at 14-2-1 through 14-2-12 NMSA 1978.


Thank you.


Amanda Olsen



Amanda Olsen, Paralegal
NM Educational Retirement Board
PO Box 26129
Santa Fe, New Mexico 87502

(505) 827-8030 fax

You previously indicated that it would be completed on Aug. 3, 2023. I wanted to let you know that I am still interested in the following documents, and to see if that date was still accurate.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Scroggins and Ms. Olsen,

Thanks for the update. Can you provide any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request, or the estimated delivery date? Please feel free to give me a call at 781-962-8816 if it'd be helpful to discuss the scope of the materials we're requesting.

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock,

I am responding to your email yesterday requesting any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request. Please be assured that we make every effort to respond promptly to every request. However, we must also ensure that we are diligent and accurate in our reply. Thus, when obtained, all documents and emails must be reviewed. Additionally, we must rely on the state agency that controls the entire state email system to identify and provide the emails requested. As you can imagine, the process takes time.

As to an estimated response date, in our letter of August 1, 2023, we noted that we intend to respond by September 6, 2023.

Thank you for your patience and please feel free to contact me if you have further questions.

Respectfully,

[cid:image001.png@01D9C623.0D3F7D80]

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Hello Ms. Garcia,

Thank you for the update. Given that it's now been five months since we filed the initial request, are you able to provide an update as to whether you've identified the responsive documents, or what the source of the delay is?

Thank you,

Rebecca

communications.subject: ATTORNEY CLIENT PRIVILEGED - RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns,

Thank you for your inquiry and please accept our apologies for the delay.

As Mr. Scroggins noted in his August 3, 2023 email regarding our projected response, we always try to be prompt.  But as you might guess, the request references a large number of records.  As he said, we must thoroughly review all records to identify and obtain the responsive documents from both external and internal sources.  It is a complex and time-consuming process.

I am confident that we will have documents ready to provide on or before the December 6th, 2023, date noted in our recent communication.

Thank you for your continued patience!
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image002.png@01DA121F.C2136CB0]

files.title: image002
files.source: New Mexico Educational Retirement Board, New Mexico

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence

Thanks so much for your help with this request! I really appreciate it.

Sincerely,
Julia Rock

communications.subject: Re: Request for Inspection of Records
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns:

As discussed in our letter of December 6, 2023, we are providing the records we currently have available in response to your June 16, 2023, request.  They are located at the website below:

MuckRock - Julia Rock<https://nmgov-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/personal/renee_garcia_erb_nm_gov/Documents/MuckRock%20-%20Julia%20Rock?csf=1&web=1&e=4gwfSH>

As also discussed, we will require additional time to provide the remainder of the records.  We plan to provide additional documents on or before February 1, 2024.  Thank you again for your continued patience regarding this matter.
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image001.png@01DA29F0.5D899B00]

Please advise at your earliest convenience.

Thank You,

MuckRock Staff

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Hello Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns,

We apologize for the error you received while trying to access the records. We will be using another method for delivery. Attached are the instructions that you will need to connect to the ERB SFTP server.  I will send you the credentials in a secure email to follow this.

As also discussed, we will require additional time to provide the remainder of the records. We plan to provide additional documents on or before February 1, 2024. Thank you again for your continued patience regarding this matter.
Regards,
Renee

title: Kimmel complaints 11/25/24-present

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Kimmel complaints 11/25/24-present
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All complaints received regarding Jimmy Kimmel Live! on ABC from November 25, 2024, until the date this request is processed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jed Rosenzweig

title: Child care provider data (Mississippi State Department of Health)

communications.subject: Mississippi Public Records Act Request: Child care provider data (Mississippi State Department of Health)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Mississippi Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Historical data on all licensed child care providers (active and closed) from as far back as data systems will allow to present. I also request data on license-exempt providers, if available. Specifically, I request the following information as it is available:

1)	Provider name or ID
2)	Street number
3)	Street name
4)	City
5)	Zip code
6)	Licensed capacity for each year (by child age group if available)
7)	Enrollment for each year (by child age group if available)
8)	Provider type (e.g., center-based provider, home-based provider, Head Start, school-based pre-K, etc.) for each year
9)	First license issue (open) date
10)	Most recent license issue date
11)	Most recent license expiration date or close date
12)	Ages served for each year
13)	Hours of operation for each year
14)	QRIS rating for each year (please explain who is required to participate and whether there are financial supports based on rating)
15)	Accepts Child Care and Development Fund subsidies for each year

communications.subject: Request 7509
communications.communication:
Gabrielle,

The Mississippi State Department of Health (MSDH) has reviewed your request for information regarding licensed and license-exempt providers. We have a couple of questions or matters we want to clarify up front:


  1.  Are we correct that you want the listed variables in your request for both licensed and license-exempt facilities?
  2.  Please note that only Provider Name and Physical Address can be provided for license-exempt facilities and our information only goes back to June 2023.

A fee will be assessed for this request but your responses to the above will obviously impact how much it will cost. Our online child facility public database may have much of what you are looking for. It can be found here:  Child Care Provider Search<https://www.msdh.provider.webapps.ms.gov/ccsearch.aspx>

Also, please note that Miss. Code Ann. 25-61-5(1)(b) allows a state entity to respond to a public records request by up to fourteen (14) business days assuming the entity has informed the requestor it will not be able to respond in seven (7) and gives reasons for it. My guess is this will take longer than seven days given the scope of information you are looking for and the limited staff available to put together our response.

Please let me know how you'd like to proceed.

Thank you,
Davy Trewolla

DAVY TREWOLLA, ESQ, CHP
Data Governance Director

Mississippi State Department of Health
570 East Woodrow Wilson Drive
Jackson, MS 39216
Office: 601-576-7855
Email: David.Trewolla@msdh.ms.gov
[Image]
To protect and advance the health,
well-being and safety of everyone
in Mississippi
msdh.ms.gov<https://msdh.ms.gov/>
[Facebook]<https://facebook.com/HealthyMS> [Instagram] <https://instagram.com/healthy.ms>  [X] <https://x.com/msdh>



This message and any attachments may contain information that is confidential and/or proprietary to the Mississippi State Department of Health, and may consist of sensitive information, including, but not limited to, protected health information as defined by the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPAA). The information contained in and attached to this message is intended for the exclusive use of the recipient(s) designated above. The use, disclosure, copying or distribution by any means to anyone other than the intended recipient(s) without the prior written permission of the Mississippi State Department of Health is strictly prohibited. Any such unauthorized use, disclosure, copying or distribution may violate federal and/or state privacy laws, including, but not limited to, HIPAA. If you have received this message or any attachments in error, please notify the sender by replying to the email or by phone, and delete this message from your computer without additional disclosure. Thank you for your assistance.

Davy

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: CPS Personnel File: Jammie Poole
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Please supply the full personnel files of the following individuals:

Jammie Poole, Interim Principal

This includes any resumes, applications, any job recommendations, promotions, professional license credentials and verification records. Please include a work/salary history. Please include any investigative materials - investigative memorandums, disciplinary actions (suspensions, leaves of absence that stem from disciplinary action), incident reports, EOCO investigations, Office of Civil Rights determinations, non-disciplinary memorandum of understandings, non-union misconduct form, full warning resolutions and any complaints or claims/lawsuits/settlements. Please include any safety plans. Please include any separation agreements and any other disclosure agreements.

This request is made on behalf of The FOIA Bakery. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Please note that certain private information (personal descriptions, employee ID numbers, college transcripts, social security numbers, citizenship status, signatures, personal addresses/phone numbers, medical information, etc.) was redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7. Specifically, section 7(1)(b) which exempts certain private information as defined by section 2(c-5) and section 7(1)(c) which exempts personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subject of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs any legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a) exempts “ information specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or State Law … ” (5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a)) Specifically, 105 ILCS 5/10-21.9 (b) states that “ any information concerning the record of convictions obtained by the president of the school board or the regional superintendent shall be confidential and may only be transmitted to the superintendent of the school district or his designee, the appropriate regional superintendent if the check was requested by the school district, the presidents of the appropriate school boards if the check was requested from the Department of State Police by the regional superintendent, the State Superintendent of Education, the State Teacher Certification Board, any other person necessary to the decision of hiring the applicant for employment, or for clarification purposes the Department of State Police or Statewide Sex Offender Database, or both.” 
Portions of this request that include personnel evaluations are redacted entirely in accordance with section 7(1)(a) of FOIA (5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a)) which exempts from public release information specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or State law or rules and regulations implementing federal or State law and also in accordance with section 7.5(q) of the FOIA (5 ILCS 140/7.5(q)) which exempts from public release information prohibited from being disclosed by the Personnel Records Review Act [820 ILCS 40/0.01 et seq.] Certain records have been withheld entirely pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(f) as factual information inextricably intertwined in predecisional processes. You have a right to have the denial of your request reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). You can file your Request for Review with the PAC by writing to: Leah Bartelt; Public Access Counselor Office of the Attorney General 500 South 2nd Street Springfield, Illinois 62706 E-mail: public.access@ilag.gov 877-299-3642 You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court. 5 ILCS 140/11. If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. Sincerely, Patricia Majchrowicz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

Dear Ed Burton,

This email is to acknowledge your Public Records Act request submitted below/attached. Appropriate University of California offices are being notified of your request and a search for the information is underway. All information identified as responsive to your request will be reviewed, and made available for your access, in accordance with relevant law and University policy. The estimated date for production of the requested records is on or around April 3rd,2025.

Although the requested records have not yet been fully gathered and reviewed, it is possible that the material may contain information exempt from disclosure pursuant to the Public Records Act. This office will provide you with a status update after the requested records have been thoroughly reviewed.

Regards,
Public Access Requests Branch
Central Intelligence Agency

This e-mail is used solely to provide a response to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request of the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA), and is not a means of communicating with CIA regarding your request. As a result, the account from which this message originated is not routinely monitored. Should you have any questions or concerns about our response, please call the CIA FOIA Hotline at +1 (703) 613-1287.

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: CO County CVR Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Cast vote record (CVR) data for the following elections:
1. 2022 Nov Midterm Election
2. 2024 Nov General Election

Specifically, I’m looking for the full anonymized record of votes cast each election generated by the voting system. An example of these records in REDACTED format is available at this link on the Arapahoe County webpage: https://www.arapahoevotes.gov/transparency
If you follow the "Redacted Cast Vote Record (CVR)" link on that webpage, it will download a csv file with Arapahoe County's redacted CVR records (this: https://gis.arapahoegov.com/dl_data/cr_voter_data/redacted_cvr/REDACTED_CVR_Export_20241126111830_330948.zip.)

I am requesting these records NOT redacted pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act. Please let me know if you need any further clarification on the type of data that I am requesting.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aleksandra Conevska

title: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Federal Transit Administration)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Federal Transit Administration)
communications.communication:
Dear Federal Transit Administration,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records:

1. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
2. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
3. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.

This request is expressly limited to Federal Transit Administration's own FOIA office. Please do not refer it to any other agency or division. This request is expressly not a Privacy Act request, and no PA waiver will be provided.

Please provide the email records in EML, Maildir, MBOX, MIX, MSG, or PST format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide the fourth record as a statement in your response letter, or at your option, as the most readily available record, in original electronic format as currently stored on your computer systems, which includes that information.

Please provide all records either as individual files, or as an unencrypted ZIP file, uploaded to MuckRock. Do not apply any encryption, DRM, or other restriction.

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial purposes;
* these records would give a snapshot of insight into the everyday processes of FOIA offices; and
* these records are being requested in order to conduct a government-wide audit of agencies' FOIA compliance.

In the event that you deny fee waiver, please process this request as-is, because I will not agree to any fees.

Please be sure to provide:
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(II) FOIA Public Liaison information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(aa) appeal information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(bb) OGIS information
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(A) tracking number
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(B)(ii) completion ETA

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.

P.S. Sai is my full legal name.

title: Department of Defense support for 2023 documentary "Brothers After War"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Department of Defense support for 2023 documentary "Brothers After War"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to collaboration between the Department of Defense (DoD) and the production of the 2023 documentary "Brothers After War" directed by Jake Rademacher and written by David Paluck. I request any and all documents pertaining to DoD support for "Brothers After War." Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of the DoD and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Brothers After War," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: CPS Governance: Email Log, January 2025, Jitu Brown

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: CPS Governance: Email Log, January 2025, Jitu Brown
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

A log of all emails to/from the CPS Board Member, Jitu Brown, from January 1, 2025 - January 31, 2025. Board Member Brown indicated that he is receiving "many emails" and "phone calls".

1. Please search all CPS email accounts as well as personal accounts used for public business. The log should include but not be limited to: sender, recipient(s), date and time, subject line, and attachment.

2. A log of all phone calls and messages for Board Member Jitu Brown from January 1, 2025 - January 31, 2025. The message log should include but not be limited to caller, date and time, message content.

This request is made on behalf of The FOIA Bakery. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Fcps-governance-email-log-january-2025-jitu-brown-182206%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ164Jy60iQjs6iHTUOyYGcc%3A1tnpjC%3AFGcec3lhfuDeDaA8H48Oi8oVkiXGX9c8G1TH5Is5rUE 
 
Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center. 

Track the issue status and respond at: https://cps.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP//_rs/RequestEdit.aspx?rid=17050

--- Please respond above this line --- 
03/14/2025 
Miriam Bhimani 
Dear Miriam Bhimani: 
RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N017050-022725 
Thank you for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. You requested the following: 
To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records: 

A log of all emails to/from the CPS Board Member, Jitu Brown, from January 1, 2025 - January 31, 2025. Board Member Brown indicated that he is receiving "many emails" and "phone calls". 

1. Please search all CPS email accounts as well as personal accounts used for public business. The log should include but not be limited to: sender, recipient(s), date and time, subject line, and attachment. 

2. A log of all phone calls and messages for Board Member Jitu Brown from January 1, 2025 - January 31, 2025. The message log should include but not be limited to caller, date and time, message content. 

This request is made on behalf of The FOIA Bakery. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Miriam Bhimani 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Fcps-governance-email-log-january-2025-jitu-brown-182206%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ164Jy60iQjs6iHTUOyYGcc%3A1tnpjC%3AFGcec3lhfuDeDaA8H48Oi8oVkiXGX9c8G1TH5Is5rUE 
RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Please note that certain private information (personal email addresses, etc.) was redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7. Specifically, section 7(1)(b) which exempts certain private information as defined by section 2(c-5) and section 7(1)(c) which exempts personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subject of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs any legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. Student information has been redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7.5 (r) which exempts from inspection or copying information prohibited from being disclosed by the Illinois School Student Records Act (ISSRA). ISSRA generally prohibits the disclosure of “school student records” and defines a “school student record” as “any writing or other recorded information concerning a student and by which a student may be individually identified, maintained by a school or at is direction or by an employee of a school, regardless of how or where the information is stored.” (105 ILCS 10/2(d). Please be advised that there are no records responsive to point two of your request. You have a right to have the denial of your request reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). You can file your Request for Review with the PAC by writing to: Leah Bartelt; Public Access Counselor Office of the Attorney General 500 South 2nd Street Springfield, Illinois 62706 E-mail: public.access@ilag.gov 877-299-3642 You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court. 5 ILCS 140/11. If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. Sincerely, Patricia Majchrowicz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools
